str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Hated, hostile; subst: an enemy. From a primary echtho; hateful; usually as a noun, an adversary.
Underneath, below, under. From hupo and kato; down under, i.e. Beneath.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
